attributes.action: Stop and review the Defence Cuts 2021
attributes.background: Cutting 10,000 troops is far to many Troop reduction in a unstable world we would not have the capability to be able to support NATO or any major conflict that may happen in the future. This is a Major failure by our Government and needs a Major review.
attributes.additional_details: If there was to be another Iraq or Or Similar conflict anywhere in the world we as a country would be expected to send and support that situation as a world power, cutting our force by 10,000 troops that’s nearly 10 full Infantry Battalions Yes Nearly 10 at 600 Hundred personnel per Battalion how can we sustain that loss when the world is so unstable.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580789

attributes.action: Install recycling bins in Nantwich town centre to combat overflowing bins
attributes.background: We would like to have some recycling bins placed in the town centre and provide education to visitors in the town centre on environmental awareness and sustainability. Currently there are only a few rubbish bins with no recycling options and bins are overflowing with recyclable items.
attributes.additional_details:
Nantwich is a beautiful, historical flower market town. St Mary's Church is situated in the heart of this bustling town and it is currently surrounded by oceans of rubbish as the bins currently situated in town are limited with NO recycling options available. 

Given the UK is progressing in an environmentally conscious and promoting sustainability, this is a wonderful opportunity to have our community enjoy this historic town and be able to preserve it and educate our visitors in sustainability

rejection.details:
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Change the current UK national rod fishing Byelaws
attributes.background:
Protect the futures of course species including  pike, perch, carp and grayling by making 'taking' course fish species illegal.

A full investigation into the current fish stocks in the United kingdom's river systems, trend data and then reform of the current byelaws to protect all species.
attributes.additional_details:
Current legislations/byelaws dictate: Each day, you can take up to 15 coarse fish. This legislation is out of date and requires immediate reform!
Fish species across the Uk face a number of threats which can be directly linked to human activities such as over fishing, pollution and poaching. Taking fish species for the table need not be another threat to the long term sustainability of our river ecosystems.
The message needs to be clear, concise and understandable by all,
Catch, release, repeat!

rejection.details:
You may like to sign this petition that we currently have open:

Review freshwater rod fishing bylaws reduce daily limit of course fish taken.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570198

attributes.action: Vaccinate all UK teaching staff in a day!
attributes.background: Once the four main priority groups have been vaccinated we would like to see all teaching staff in UK schools vaccinated in one day so that children can go back to school and their parents can go back to their own jobs or job search!  We need this to help with mental health and sustain learning.
attributes.additional_details: Matt Hancock said that 1 million vaccine doses a day is possible.  Even at the current rate of vaccination it should only take 2 days to get the entire UK schools staff their first vaccine.  Studies of teacher assessments are already showing the obvious and expected negative impact of learning but what is not being quantified is the detrimental impact on mental health for children, parents and staff alike.  Let’s get back to school safely, providing a beacon of hope for the wider community.

rejection.details:
Decisions on the logistics of rollout of vaccines is a matter for the NHS not the UK Government and Parliament, and depends on the availability of vaccine and people to administer it. 

You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554316

attributes.action: Help put postal workers on NHS priority list for vaccinations against COVID 19
attributes.background: During this time, Royal Mail has seen a lot of sickness, self-isolations and many casualties as a result of COVID-19. We would like the government to include postal workers on the list of priority groups for vaccines.
attributes.additional_details: We would like the government to help the Royal Mail. We have seen many postal workers scared of coming into work because of concerns over this disease, we deliver almost every day of the week, putting ourselves at risk to give customers the service they deserve, I believe we can sustain a better service going forward if postal workers, as backed by our union, if postal workers were given the vaccine.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Prioritise Couriers/Postal Workers for COVID vaccination
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572604

attributes.action: Urgent - Vaccinate Teachers and Get Children Back to School
attributes.background: I am a self-employed Social Worker and have been trying to work full-time and homeschool my son aged 10 throughout times when schools have been closed due to COVID-19 (his father also works full-time away from the home). Our mental health is suffering immensely and I cannot work effectively.
attributes.additional_details: The government need to make vaccinating teachers an absolute priority as a matter of urgency. I have many friends whose mental health has been greatly affected due to trying to homeschool young children and work full-time in demanding roles. This is no longer sustainable and working parents like myself need support and children must return to school imminently.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554316

attributes.action: Stop allowing exceptions to the ban on products containing a neonicotinoid.
attributes.background: If the Government make Emergency, Urgent or other exceptions to this rule it removes the pressure on the growers to  plan for developing alternative, sustainable approaches to protect crops without the use of neonicotinoid seed treatments. Help them with this work instead of just lifting the ban.
attributes.additional_details: The natural  world is under threat. Every bird that dies from contaminated seed, every bee that fails to thrive because of contaminated pollen, is something we simply cannot afford to lose.  The Government made a great decision to ban neonicotinoid seed treatments. Please stick to it.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids

attributes.action: Ban all supertrawlers and other destructive fishing methods within UK waters
attributes.background: Once the uk leave the eu we will have upto 200 miles offshore fishing and they can't be sustained with giant trawlers fishing our waters killing everything in there paths,it can't be environmentally friendly.
attributes.additional_details: Because its the right thing to do,and will give our fishing industry a chance to grow and prosper

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550730

attributes.action: Make schools use all the safety measures required in all other indoor settings
attributes.background: Put in place all of the same Covid safety measures, as are required in all other indoor settings where households mix into UK schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Prioritise safety in order to have a safe and sustainable education provision for all throughout a global pandemic.
The long-term effects of even asymptomatic infections are still unknown. Unnecessarily exposing pupils, school staff and their families to an as yet not fully understood novel virus is an example of organisational abuse.

rejection.details:
We understand you'd like the restrictions on schools to change, however it's not clear what you'd like them to change to - the restrictions on indoor settings vary depending on the nature of the setting itself.

If there are specific restrictions on certain other indoor settings that you'd like to apply to schools, you could start a petition about that.

attributes.action: Reduce Firework Noise, Hours per Day & Number of Days per Year they are set off
attributes.background:
Reduce hours per day fireworks can be set off to 6pm-11pm & 6pm-1am New Year/Recognised celebrations
Reduce the decibels of a firework
Increase costs/criteria for public display licenses
Enforce current regulations regarding livestock
Disallow pop up/ad hoc sellers
Increase penalties for misuse
attributes.additional_details: Every year there are countless examples seen of injuries & deaths sustained from the use of fireworks, people searching out the bigger bangs with no thought to their neighbours, in fact boasting about it. Reducing the number of hours and days would allow people to be better prepared and have measures in place, reducing the noise would allow a chance of being able to drown them out which is currently impossible, reducing the noise has the potential to reduce the appeal for illegal and extreme use

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions calling for similar actions:

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Review and reduce the decibel limit on fireworks sold to the public: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

Make it illegal for fireworks to be set off on days other than Nov 5 and Dec 31: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559397

Your petition refers to enforcing livestock regulations, but this would be a matter for relevant local authorities and police forces, not the Government or House of Commons.

Your petition also refers to increasing the cost of public display licences, but these are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling for penalties for misuse of fireworks to be increased, or for changes to the times and dates at which fireworks can be released (other than those requests by the above), if you would like to start a new petition on this issue.

The Petitions Committee held a debate on 2 November 2020 on fireworks following the success of a petition about banning the sale of fireworks to the general public, that was started in the last Parliament.

You can watch the debate here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pLDheB0lygI

And read a transcript of it here: https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2020-11-02/debates/F982D230-02C0-4A8B-8A60-D0C51F952944/Fireworks

attributes.action: UK to extend recent redundancy consultations and give furlough to staff affected
attributes.background:
The government have extended furlough and offered this to those recently made redundant. Instead it should be mandatory that consultations are extended during November and furlough offered.

This is due to business change for second lockdown and the previous consultations being void economically
attributes.additional_details:
Lockdown prevents spread of disease and furlough helps sustain the economy only if this package is enforced to those affected by Gov late decision!

Without this option the economy suffers on all areas. Jobs are lost, homes may be lost, there will be low influx for Xmas and more. These issues cost the government more in the long run and cause mass suffering by leaving this decision open to businesses.

Is furlough their for people and overall economy health or for private business manipulation?

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about people who have been or being made redundant as a result of Covid-19, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do about this.

It is up to individual businesses, not the Government, to decide whether to reemploy staff that have previously been made redundant, although the Government does set rules on processes employers must follow to make staff redundant. Similarly, it is up to individual businesses, not the Government, to decide when to use the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to extend minimum consultation periods for redundancy during the pandemic, or to provide financial support equivalent to the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme for workers who have been made redundant.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Make Companies who make furloughed employees redundant pay them a retraining fee: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327197

Businesses to repay furlough if subsequently making redundancies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326870

Prevent companies making employees redundant or laying them off due to COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305475

attributes.action: Keep Places of Worship Open
attributes.background: We call on the government to keep places of worship open as an essential part of the life of our nation.
attributes.additional_details: In agreement with the calls from the leaders of the British faith communities, we argue that public  worship is essential to sustain our service. Public worship is necessary for social cohesion and connectedness. Public worship is important for the mental health of our nation. Public worship is an essential sign of hope.

rejection.details:
Places of worship are able to remain open for independent prayer, funerals or funeral commemorative events, to broadcast an act of worship, to provide essential voluntary services or urgent public support services, for registered childcare, and to host permitted gatherings: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/new-national-restrictions-from-5-november

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Allow corporate worship and congregational singing at places of worship: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548621

attributes.action: Request thre government to end the Covid Tier System restrictions.
attributes.background: The tier system is a flawed and inept system of restrictions designed to reduce Covid 19 infections, I'ts limited impact on infections is outweighed by the damage to the economy, jobs and health of UK citizens. It should be removed  and the restrictions on UK citizens lifted.
attributes.additional_details:
To help sustain employment in the retail and leisure industry.
To allow people to make choices about the risk of infection rather than be nannied by the state.
To accept lockdown methods do more harm than good.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551469

attributes.action: Stop the killing of sharks for vaccinations
attributes.background: Sharks are being killed for their Squalene oil, an oil that naturally occurs. It is used as a carrier for vaccines. Half a million sharks will have to be killed to supply the world with a vaccine. When this oil can be derived from plants, why are we killing these animals.
attributes.additional_details: Squalene oil is found in plants, animals and humans. Sharks livers are rich in this oil and it is being used by companies such as GlaxoSmithKline in vaccine manufacturing. It is estimated that half a MILLION sharks will have to die to supply a vaccine to the entire population. Our oceans are already hugely depleted, fish stocks that support economies and the food supply will collapse. Sustainable plant based squalene is readily available derived from olives, so why are we killing these animals.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552673

attributes.action: Sustainable Reform - 8 proposals for fundamental changes to British politics
attributes.background:
1 Mental health reform. 
 2 Electoral reform. (proportional)
 3 Industrial reform (hemp).
 4  Secular spiritual reform (Wellness studies and Education in the nature of the mind)
 5 Energy reform (renewable energy.)
6 Universal Basic Income
7 Gross National Happiness.
8 Police reform
attributes.additional_details:
1 Mental health reform, a preventative approach 
 2 Electoral reform (proportional)
 3 Industrial Reform - Hemp can replace almost every aspect of the oil industry. 
 4 Secular Spiritual Reform (Wellness studies and Education in the nature of the mind)
 5 Energy reform (renewable energy.)
Every human on the planet needs clean air and clean water.
6 Universal Basic Income
7 Gross National Happiness
The collective happiness and well-being

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do in each of these chases
	
You could start new petitions explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: The UK Government should return all illegal immigrants immediately.
attributes.background: Illegal immigrants  should be deported  immediately to avoid the UK  from paying for their accommodation and keep.
attributes.additional_details:
48,000 asylum seekers  are provided with hotel accommodation in the UK.  This is a cost we cannot sustain . Remove all of them quickly and 
deny them asylum status.

rejection.details:
Under international law, it is legal for a person to apply for asylum in any country that has signed the 1951 Geneva Convention and to remain there until the authorities have assessed their claim.

You could start a new petition asking the UK Government to withdraw from international treaties that give people the right to seek asylum in the UK, if that's what you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Actively promote bus & rail travel as part of 'Green recovery' from Coronavirus.
attributes.background: While understandably social distancing has to take place to prevent spread of the virus, the message 'not to travel by bus or train' will not assist in the green recovery. Changing the message to 'safe bus & rail travel' will work alongside and complement the recent active travel measures.
attributes.additional_details:
Rail travel is an important component of de-carbonisation of transport in the UK, as well as the promotion of active travel methods to get to and from stations will help with modal shift towards greener methods of travel. 

The reduction of air pollution is seen as a priority by Government, and will assist in combating the Coronavirus Crisis as well as tackling obesity and other health issues. 

This will also help the railways become much more financially sustainable.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action:

Rebuild the economy out of lockdown with a Green New Deal 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Make the wearing of a helmet whilst cycling compulsory.
attributes.background: I would like the government and parliament to make the wearing of a helmet compulsory when out cycling. I still see too many people cycling without a helmet. Adults put helmets on children but don’t wear one themselves? It’s not only ridiculous but completely irresponsible.
attributes.additional_details: To protect people from sustaining life threatening injuries or even death. Prevent children from losing a parent and prevent parents from losing a child.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315987

attributes.action: End this inhumane 23+ hour lockdown for prisoners in all uk jails
attributes.background: End the inhumane 23 hour bang up of our loved ones in uk jails. The covid risk has gone down, visitors are allowed to enter the hmps, jail staff are allowed to mix outside of work.This bang up is acfecting inmates mental health & suicide is on the increase!
attributes.additional_details: The prisoners need to get back into recieving proper sustained-  exercise- for physical fitness needs/ mental health needs. They need to get back into employment within  the hmp, to keep  busy & for a sense of self and education needs to get back up and running so courses can be completed in order to progress through the prison system & to rehabilitate.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Relaxing restrictions introduced during the pandemic is an operational matter for individual institutions.

We could accept a petition calling for the UK Government or Parliament to introduce rules about the maximum time a prisoner can be forced to spend in their cell, if this is something you would like to happen.

You may wish to sign this petition:
Enable early release of prisoners who have been in lockdown due to Covid-19:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331465

attributes.action: Lead the world in massively reducing our meat consumption accross the UK
attributes.background: The Government needs to recognise the environmental impact of animal agriculture (especially beef production) and make steps to reduce it. More sustainable backyard farming should be encouraged and farms should have a cap on beef production encouraging smaller back yard farming for self sustaining.
attributes.additional_details: Animal agriculture also has a huge impact to human life. The crisis in Yemen is a preventable tragedy considering we have enough land to feed the planet if we reduce our meat consumption. Millions of Yemen's population are at risk of dying from malnutrition including children and pregnant or lactating women. On top of this, deforestation in the Amazon and other rainforest effect humans and wildlife habitats alike. To not address this issue is to persue financial gain over human beings lives.

rejection.details:

attributes.additional_details: In 2018, beauty service providers contributed to £4.8 billion to the UK economy (Oxford Economics, 2019). attributes.background:

“plan how we can ensure that as many people as possible can move into the long term sustainable and safe accommodation that they deserve once the pandemic is over. We’re determined that as few people as possible will return to life on the streets.”

attributes.action: Implement Black History as a compulsory topic on the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
Racism is inherent and structural. It is built into society. One of the biggest forces we have for change, over the long term, is education.

Young people in schools shouldn’t just be taught about tolerance and respect for all. 

They need to understand the history; Black history.
attributes.additional_details:
Black history should be taught as part of the national curriculum. It’s imperative, if we’re ever to see sustained change, to educate young people about race, racism, the history of racism, the slave trade, white privilege and what this history means for society today.

This affects us all. It affects all of our futures. It is imperative in overcoming inequity, inequality, and injustice to make Black History a compulsory component of the National Curriculum.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality

attributes.action: Reopen Household Waste and Recycling Centres
attributes.background:
Government need to reopen Household Waste & Recycling centres. Using skeleton staff on rotation. Clear social distancing rules and measures in place. And allow materials to be recycled free of charge.
Allowing both landowners & individuals to feel they won't be penalised for making better choices.
attributes.additional_details:
Fly tipping has always been a growing issue in the UK. Even with the threat of fines individuals or companies will still dump rubbish that they cannot afford to recycle.

Ultimately we want to have a sustainable country that prides itself on innovate ways of being better. 

Isn't it about time that we stop charging individuals or companies for doing the right thing, taking all materials to be disposed of correctly and reward them, by inviting them to do this free of charge.

attributes.action: Immediate & Sustained Increased Wages for Our NHS / Emergency & Care Staff
attributes.background: Increase the wages of our NHS, Emergency & Care Workers immediately, to compensate for a decade's lack of relative pay increases and commit to sustained, above inflation increases over the next decade, in order to financially elevate them to the position in society, they have proved they deserve.
attributes.additional_details: Since austerity began over a decade ago, Our Health Workers have seen real world reductions in wages, year on year. During the CV-19 pandemic, they proved themselves to be fundamental to UK Society. Remuneration should be commensurate with daily efforts and sacrifices. They are risking death to keep the people of the UK alive. A Thursday applause is not sufficient recognition. Their wages should be increased immediately to compensate and future wage level increased, relative to other UK workers.

attributes.action: Close all non essential warehouses that dont sell food or essential living items
attributes.background: Close down all non essential, life sustaining online shopping to protect the thousands of workers risking their lives in warehouses and delivery jobs delivering items that people can live without during lockdown I.e clothes, furniture.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

An Environment Bill, to make provision about targets, plans and policies for improving the natural environment; for statements and reports about environmental protection; for the Office for Environmental Protection; about waste and resource efficiency; about air quality; for the recall of products that fail to meet environmental standards; about water; about nature and biodiversity; for conservation covenants; about the regulation of chemicals; and for connected purposes, is already being considered by Parliament. attributes.action: Prevent the ‘big six’ Premier League teams from joining a European Super League.
attributes.background: (I) Enact legislation to outlaw this action; or ( (II) Pressurise the Football Association (FA) to levy penalties, monetary and/or non-monetary, on the football clubs involved.
attributes.additional_details: As a governmental public institution with law making powers and influence over domestic associations, it is in the public interest to take such appropriate action. Not only does it potentially infringe upon anti-competitive provisions, it will have a devastating financial impact on non-participating football clubs, particularly in relation to a sustained period of economic restructuring enforced by the ongoing global pandemic.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about English clubs joining the proposed European Super League, however since you started your petition the Government has clearly expressed its opposition to the plans and the six participating English clubs have all withdrawn, as you may know.

On Monday 19 April the Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden MP said that he was appalled by the announcement that a handful of clubs are proposing to form their own breakaway European league, ands said the Government would not hesitate to protect one of our greatest national institutions: football. The Culture Secretary said that the Government would back the football authorities to stop this move, and if the football authorities couldn’t act, the Government would. The Culture Secretary said the Government would "put everything on the table to prevent this from happening."

You can read the Culture Secretary's full statement on the European Super League here: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/statement-by-oliver-dowden-on-the-european-super-league

You can read a report about the English clubs' withdrawal from the European Super League here: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/56823501.

Further, on 19 April the Government announced a 'Fan-led review of football governance', which will explore ways of improving the governance, ownership and financial sustainability of clubs in English football, building on the strengths of the football pyramid. You can read more about this review here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/fan-led-review-of-football-governance

You may like to sign this petition which calls for a related action:

'Enforce the “50+1” Rule for professional football club ownership in the UK': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583310.

attributes.background: The UK currently is the second largest exporter of plastic to poorer countries. The EU have banned export of plastic from 1 January 2021, however we have not. The plastic that we export often ends up in the ocean polluting the ecosystems of our planet, or it is burnt or ends up as land fill waste.
attributes.additional_details: We need to be leading the way on environmental issues such as this. It is not okay for the UK to be exporting plastic. We should be actively looking into sustainable alternatives to plastic use in the UK and also stepping up our own recycling abilities. It is also not okay that we are asking poorer countries to take our waste, for then it to pollute the environment in so many harmful ways. This is a global concern, that we have the utmost responsibility for.

attributes.action: Enact the socio-economic duty in the Equality Act and make EIAs mandatory
attributes.background: The socio-economic duty in the Equality Act should be enacted and Equality Impact Assessments made mandatory to help ensure that future generations, regardless of background, are fully and equally accounted for in government decision making relating to health, environment and wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details: This is particularly important where decisions have the potential to widen intergenerational inequality. Children are vulnerable to severe impacts from government decision making. They have no legal representation in process, and their future needs as citizens who deserve sustainable lives is poorly factored in. The coronavirus response, resulting educational disruption for those who can tolerate it least without adequate mitigation, and the failure to respond adequately to the climate crisis, demonstrate that something is wrong in how government accounts for and acts on equality issues.

attributes.action: Delay the opening of Schools, Colleges and Universities.
attributes.background: The opening of educational establishments should be delayed until proven safe and sustainable, to assist the already buckling NHS. The new strain of Covid 19 is demonstrating explosive growth even whilst they are closed. They are proven breeding grounds and should not reopen at this time.
attributes.additional_details: The figures clearly show that when educational establishments returned for the Autumn term, that Covid 19 figures sky-rocketed. With this new strain of Covid that is up to 70% more transmissible, one can only imagine what a similar return would now do. The NHS is already on it's knees and needs any and all the help it can get. To allow on-site education to resume now would likely trigger a healthcare disaster on a scale not seen in several generations. We need full lockdown, not people mingling.

attributes.action: Prioritise the development of a sustainable circular economy.
attributes.background: Up to 99% of goods end up in landfills or are burned to produce fuel (EfW) within 6 months of purchase. This is both inherently wasteful and bad for the planet. An SCE makes better use of resources than our current linear economy, prevents waste and pollution, and provides employment in recycling.
attributes.additional_details: For the sake of current and future generations, we have to be more responsible in our use of resources. Energy from Waste (EfW) has only minor benefits - producing fuel - as against major deficits - waste of resources and increased pollution. A linear economy uses increasing amounts of virgin resources which is unsustainable. Recycling is still underutilized. An ESC would be a sustainable economy going forward into the future. This is based on research from the University of Leeds.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to make the UK more sustainable, but it's not clear what action you want the Government to take to achieve this. We can only accept petitions that request a clear action.
